meanings.definition: To control or guide with reins.
meanings.sent1: She reined the horse to make it stop.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy expertly reined in the wild stallion.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be a princess reining in her magical unicorn.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like a wild horse, difficult to rein in.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reined in the noisy classroom with a stern look.

meanings.sent1: He reined his excitement when he saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The police officer reined in the suspect before he could escape.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to rein in his urge to add too much salt to the dish.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was like a wild horse that she struggled to rein in.
meanings.sent5: The team captain reined in his frustration and motivated his teammates to keep going.
